These metrics are commonly used in classification tasks to assess the performance of a model. Sensitivity measures the proportion of true positive cases correctly identified by the SVM classifier. Specificity measures the proportion of true negative cases correctly identified by the SVM classifier. Accuracy measures the overall correctness of the SVM classifier by calculating the proportion of correctly classified cases (both true positives and true negatives) out of the total number of cases.

The extent to which these metrics can go in evaluating the performance of SVM classification depends on the specific dataset and problem being studied.
